channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: Derek Brockway walks in Dylan Thomas's footsteps around Swansea before heading to the Llansteffan Peninsula and the Three Rivers estuary.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Canal Boat Diaries
channel.desc: Robbie begins his 300-mile adventure across the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair while on the Tinsley lock flight.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Archaeology
channel.desc: A look at how attention turned from civilisation and kings to the search for the common man against a background of science and competing political ideologies.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Thatcher
channel.desc: Splits in Mrs Thatcher's cabinet and public anger lead to her eventual downfall.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: David Hare Remembers... The Absence of War
channel.desc: Screenwriter David Hare looks back on his 1995 political drama The Absence of War, a fictional account of a Labour general election campaign.

channel.title: The Absence of War - Screen Two
channel.desc: Political drama written by David Hare and starring John Thaw. Labour leader George Jones battles with his party on the campaign trail of a general election. Contains some strong language.

channel.title: Masters of the Canvas - Arena
channel.desc: When pop artist Peter Blake confessed that his fantasy was to be the mysterious masked wrestler Kendo Nagasaki, little did he know what the consequences would be. From 1992.

channel.title: Halloween
channel.desc: Horror-suspense story about Michael Myers, a murderous lunatic who escapes incarceration. Contains some violence and disturbing scenes.

channel.title: Hauntings

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Flying Gardener
channel.desc: Chris Beardshaw travels to both Devon and Cornwall to discover how plants survive in the most exposed areas of Britain, and he transforms a local resident's balcony using miniatures and bonsai.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: James encounters Oliver and Roland Strong - rabbit breeder and prize cabbage grower respectively - who haven't spoken to each other for half a century.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: Alfred, the local confectioner's beloved cat, falls ill, and James cannot find the cause. Meanwhile, sheep farmer Braithwaite sells his farm to an eager but inexperienced couple.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Ian McNeice Remembers... Edge of Darkness
channel.desc: Actor Ian McNeice looks back on the 1985 political thriller Edge of Darkness, which quickly established itself as a landmark series in British TV history.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Edge of Darkness
channel.desc: Thriller set in a world of obsessive state security. Ronald Craven is haunted by the murder of his daughter and begins his own investigation into her death. Contains some violent scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Edge of Darkness
channel.desc: Craven goes to London to find out more about his daughter's murder and begins to realise the full extent of her political involvement. Contains some violent scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Parkinson
channel.desc: Michael Parkinson in conversation with Spike Milligan, James Coburn and Professor Eric Laithwaite.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Mrs Weaver has moved, and Tom wants to take the oil from her central heating tank. Jerry is trying to discredit a colleague, and Margo is asked to play the lead in a production.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Prime Minister
channel.desc: Jim sees how he can use the health minister's desire to abolish smoking through taxation to stop Treasury opposition to his plans for tax cuts.

channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Man Alive
channel.desc: Documentary, first transmitted in 1970, that visits a typical office and films the preparations for the annual Christmas party, the event itself and the aftermath.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Age of Uncertainty
channel.desc: JK Galbraith examines WWI as an instrument for social change, looking especially at Lenin, who spent most of the war exiled in Switzerland urging soldiers to start a world revolution.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Age of Uncertainty
channel.desc: From the elegant banks of 17th-century Amsterdam to the dark days of the Great Depression, JK Galbraith traces the history of money - its uses and abuses, successes and disasters.

channel.title: Spring
channel.desc: Documentary celebrating spring on planet Earth, and the extraordinary tricks that animals and plants find to rise to the new challenges it brings.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Stolen
channel.desc: The 1994 theft of one of the world's most famous paintings, The Scream, and the hunt to get it back expose the depths to which criminals go to gain a get-out-of-jail card for murder.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Call My Bluff

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Patricia Owen, John Julius Norwich and David Attenborough. With guest musician David Willcocks.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Chelsea Hotel - Arena
channel.desc: First transmitted in 1981, this documentary looks at New York's Chelsea Hotel - a haven for some of the 20th century's greatest talents, from Mark Twain to Dylan Thomas.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Francis Bacon - Arena
channel.desc: On the occasion of his 75th birthday, Francis Bacon talks with great candour to his friend of many years, the distinguished writer and critic David Sylvester. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great Philosophers
channel.desc: Bryan Magee and his guest, Sir Geoffrey Warnock, discuss the work of German philosopher Immanuel Kant.

channel.name: BBC4 UK

channel.title: Inside Museums
channel.desc: National Museum of History. 1/4. Cerys Matthews shares her passion for St Fagans National Museum of History in Cardiff to reveal a story of community spirit that spans millennia.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Canal Boat Diaries
channel.desc: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming as he navigates a Roman waterway and a tidal river.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Has the good life come to an end for Tom and Barbara.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Prime Minister
channel.desc: Dorothy Wainwright, the PM's political advisor, tells Jim that he is letting Humphrey become too dominant.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: How the Celts Saved Britain
channel.desc: Dan Snow reveals how the Irish saved Britain from cultural oblivion in the Dark Ages, as missionaries brought literacy and technology to Scotland and England.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Gunpowder Plot
channel.desc: Documentary that re-examines the attempt to blow up the Houses of Parliament in 1605. Computer graphics recreate the scene and show how close the plotters came to success.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Jet Set - Timeshift
channel.desc: A look at the glamorous heyday of the international jet set from the 1950s to the 1970s, the golden age before celebrity became a dirty word. Contributors include Jackie Stewart.[(96057)]
